title: Training Input error in MNIST templates generation
body:
**MNIST templates generation**

Hi, thank you for the great work! I am learning to reproduce the MNIST templates generation, but it reports the following input error when it tries to train:


Training:   0%|                                                 0/100 ETA: ?s,  ?epochs/sTraceback (most recent call last):
  File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/vxm/template_vxm_mnist.py", line 114, in <module>
    hist = model.fit(gen, epochs=100, steps_per_epoch=25, verbose=0, callbacks=[tqdm_cb])
  File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/keras/utils/traceback_utils.py", line 67, in error_handler
    raise e.with_traceback(filtered_tb) from None
  File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/func_graph.py", line 1147, in autograph_handler
    raise e.ag_error_metadata.to_exception(e)
ValueError: in user code:
    File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/keras/engine/training.py", line 1021, in train_function  *
        return step_function(self, iterator)
    File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/keras/engine/training.py", line 1010, in step_function  **
        outputs = model.distribute_strategy.run(run_step, args=(data,))
    File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/keras/engine/training.py", line 1000, in run_step  **
        outputs = model.train_step(data)
    File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/keras/engine/training.py", line 859, in train_step
        y_pred = self(x, training=True)
    File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/keras/utils/traceback_utils.py", line 67, in error_handler
        raise e.with_traceback(filtered_tb) from None
    File "/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/anaconda3/envs/vxmm/lib/python3.10/site-packages/keras/engine/input_spec.py", line 200, in assert_input_compatibility
        raise ValueError(f'Layer "{layer_name}" expects {len(input_spec)} input(s),'

    ValueError: Layer "template_creation" expects 1 input(s), but it received 2 input tensors. Inputs received: [<tf.Tensor 'IteratorGetNext:0' shape=(None, None, None, None) dtype=float32>, <tf.Tensor 'IteratorGetNext:1' shape=(None, None, None, None) dtype=float32>]


Not sure if it is a version incompatibility issue but I tried several upgrades and downgrades with no luck. I follow pretty much the tutorials VoxelMorphTemplate.ipynb and the code I use is the following:

import os
import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow_addons as tfa  # for TQDM callback
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from tqdm import tqdm_notebook as tqdm
import nibabel as nib
import voxelmorph as vxm
import neurite as ne

tf.compat.v1.experimental.output_all_intermediates(True)

def plot_hist(hist):
  plt.figure(figsize=(17,5))
  plt.subplot(1, 2, 1)
  plt.plot(hist.epoch, hist.history['loss'], '.-')
  plt.ylabel('loss')
  plt.xlabel('epochs');
  plt.subplot(1, 2, 2)
  nb_epochs = len(hist.epoch) // 2
  plt.plot(hist.epoch[-nb_epochs:], hist.history['loss'][-nb_epochs:], '.-')
  plt.ylabel('loss')
  plt.xlabel('epochs');
  plt.show()

tqdm_cb = tfa.callbacks.TQDMProgressBar(leave_epoch_progress=False, show_epoch_progress=False) 
from tensorflow.keras.datasets import mnist
(x_train_all, y_train_all), (x_test_all, y_test_all) = tf.keras.datasets.mnist.load_data(path="/data/sha_aic/Users/z004m3mz/vxm/mnist.npz")

x_train_all = x_train_all.astype('float')/255
x_test_all = x_test_all.astype('float')/255

x_train_all = np.pad(x_train_all, ((0, 0), (2, 2), (2, 2)), 'constant')[..., np.newaxis]
x_test_all = np.pad(x_test_all, ((0, 0), (2, 2), (2, 2)), 'constant')[..., np.newaxis]

vol_shape = list(x_train_all.shape[1:-1])

digit = 3

x_train = x_train_all[y_train_all == digit, ...]
y_train = y_train_all[y_train_all == digit]
x_test = x_test_all[y_test_all == digit, ...].astype('float')/255
y_test = y_test_all[y_test_all == digit]

def template_gen(x, batch_size):
  vol_shape = list(x.shape[1:-1])
  zero = np.zeros([batch_size] + vol_shape + [2])
  mean_atlas = np.repeat(  np.mean(x, 0, keepdims=True), batch_size, 0)
  while True:
      idx = np.random.randint(0, x.shape[0], batch_size)
      img = x[idx, ...]
      inputs = [mean_atlas, img]
      outputs = [img, zero, zero, zero]
      yield inputs, outputs

sample = next(template_gen(x_train, 8))
[f.shape for f in sample[0]], [f.shape for f in sample[1]]

enc_nf = [16, 32, 32, 32]
dec_nf = [32, 32, 32, 32, 32, 16, 16]

model = vxm.networks.TemplateCreation(vol_shape, nb_unet_features=[enc_nf, dec_nf])

image_loss_func = vxm.losses.MSE().loss
neg_loss_func = lambda _, y_pred: image_loss_func(model.references.atlas_tensor, y_pred)
losses = [image_loss_func, neg_loss_func, vxm.losses.MSE().loss, vxm.losses.Grad('l2', loss_mult=2).loss]
loss_weights = [0.5, 0.5, 1, 0.01]

model.compile('adam', loss=losses, loss_weights=loss_weights)

gen = template_gen(x_train, batch_size=8)
hist = model.fit(gen, epochs=100, steps_per_epoch=25, verbose=0, callbacks=[tqdm_cb])

plot_hist(hist)

atlas = model.references.atlas_layer.get_weights()[0][..., 0]
plt.imshow(atlas, cmap='gray')
plt.axis('off');
plt.title('atlas')

Would you please have a look and suggest where to fix? Thank you very much in advance!


![snapped](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47929196/194732578-3d1b7b99-b345-4530-a1d7-00bf7def6d35.jpg)
